source.a794c4aa:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import folium
import ast
source.0eed167f:
fig, axes = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(18, 8), sharey=True)
fig.suptitle('Kill Difference, Kill/Death, and Rating')

# Kill Difference
sns.histplot(ax=axes[0], x=df_players['kd_diff'])
axes[0].set_title('Kill Difference')

# Kill/Death
sns.histplot(ax=axes[1], x=df_players['kd'])
axes[1].set_title('Kill/Death')

# Rating
sns.histplot(ax=axes[2], x=df_players['rating'])
axes[2].set_title('Rating')

plt.show()
source.f1f4d83c:
team_counts = []
for i in df_players['teams']:
    x = ast.literal_eval(i)
    mylist = list(dict.fromkeys(x))
    counts = len(mylist)
    team_counts.append(counts)
source.7fe444c0:

sns.heatmap(corr_matrix, annot=True, cmap='RdYlGn')
plt.title('Correlation Map: Total Maps, Total Rounds, Kill/Death Diffrence, Kill/Death, and Rating', size=15)

source.c2528bb3:
player_countries_new = player_countries.replace({"United States": "United States of America", "Korea": "South Korea"})

country_geo = '../input/world-countries/world-countries.json'

player_map = folium.Map(location=[0, 0], zoom_start=2)

folium.Choropleth(geo_data = country_geo,
                 data=player_countries_new,
                 columns=['country', 'count'],
                 key_on='feature.properties.name',
                 fill_color='YlGnBu',
                 fill_opacity=0.7,
                 line_opacity=0.2,
                 legend_name='Players by each Country'
                 ).add_to(player_map)

player_map
source.c844cb12: With e-sports getting bigger day by day and evolving to be one of the biggest emerging markets, we look at one of the most popular games, CSGO and its professional games stats. In this notebook, we will focus on the players stats data. Let's have a look!
source.99ba8acf:
Do we want to know where are the players come from? From which countries that the most CS:GO players are come from?

Let's answer that below!
source.2433347c: From the graph above, we can see the total rounds of each players in the top 10. We have 6 players that have rounds played above 5000. Again, on this data, we cannot find the players from the top 10 player ratings. Unfortunately, we can't calculate the duration that the players have been played those rounds because the data is not availiable.
source.0bf88a45: Then, we should know, is there any correlation between the feature? Which features are most affected the ratings? Let's see below!
source.043ee7d6: Not only maps played, but the rounds played also important to the experience of the player.
source.1d4a6421: While the experience is important before the tournaments, but the most important is the actual performance in a match or tournament. Let's have a look on the Kill Difference
source.5f930093: The data already sorted by the ratings of the player.
source.71b7e22a: From the heatmap above, we can conclude that the Ratings are strongly affected by Kill/Death Difference and Kill per Death. While Kill/Death Difference and Kill per Death are also strongly affected by each other.
source.3688259d: We will focus on these top 10 players for the rest of the analysis.
source.b37067eb: From the graph above, we can conclude that there there are players that represent more than one team. Maybe before or after tournaments, many teams have recruited another member from other teams.
source.f3819b96: From the graph above, we can see that the top 10 Kill/Death are between 1.31 to 1.43. One of the player is outside the top 10 player ratings, the rest are the top 10 players based on ratings. The rank on this graph also different from the rank in the top 10 based on ratings. Despite being in the top of the list of top 10 player ratings, ZywOo, is only rank 3rd in this category. While the 1st is sh1ro whose 5th on the top 10 player ratings.
source.fc2189c6: Now, we will have a look at the maps. The maps played by the players will have the impact on their experience with the maps itself.
source.00c0e62f: Next, we will have a look at the Kill per Death from each players.
source.7d28527e: When we look at the data, in the column Teams, there are several players that have represent more than one team in the tournament. Let's have a look!
source.6a5b3ddb: We can see only three players that have reached more than 2000 match played on different maps. None of them included in the top 10 player ratings.
source.88c1ebb1: From the graph above, we can see relatively big difference in the top three with 1000 separates each other. Different from two previous data from experience side, in this graph, we have two players from the top 10 ratings. One is being on top of the list is s1mple which is the second player with the highest rating, and the other one is the player with the highest ratings, ZywOo, in the 7th.
